original: GRANHOLM, Johan Hjalmar, Professor, Göteborg, f Umeå ldsförs 20/1 00 av löjtn Per G o Hilda Forsberg, gm Anna-Mari Åström. KTH 21, tekn dr 29. Anst v o v.-byggn.branschen i Sv o USA 21—26, ass KTH 26—29, tf prof i byggn. Statik 27—32, kont-ch h byggm O Engkvist 29—31, eg konsult verks.h f hus-, bro- o hamnbyggn sed. 31, prof i byggn.tekn CTH 38. Konstr f bl a Katarinahissen, Gbgs kons.hus, Stat hist mus, Halmst rådh, Thuleh o Södersjukh Sthlm, fabr.byggn f Sthlms sup.fosf.fabr Stockvik o Sv skifferoljev Kvarntorp, Svinesundsbron, fi brobyggn i utl, oceankajen i Karlshamn mfl ka j by ggn. Utredn f 31 års väg- o bro-sakk. Studieres Tyskl o Belg på uppdr av Civ luftsk.komm 36. Av trycket: Red av tidskr Betong 26—37, On the Elastic Stability of Piles etc (grad.avh) 29, Utredn ang lämpligh av betongrör f Vägtrummor 34, Lastfördeln mell balkar 36, Om dämpn av svängningar 41, Armerade tegelkonstr 43, Beräkn av hängbroar 43, upps o avhandl i byggn.statik o byggn.tekn.
translated: GRANHOLM, Johan Hjalmar, Professor, Gothenburg, born in Umeå parish on January 20, 1900, the son of Lieutenant Per G and Hilda Forsberg, married to Anna-Mari Åström. Graduated from the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) in 1921, obtained a doctoral degree in engineering in 1929. Employed in the construction industry in Sweden and the USA from 1921 to 1926, assistant at KTH from 1926 to 1929, acting professor in building statics from 1927 to 1932. Engaged as a consultant for the construction company O Engkvist from 1929 to 1931, afterwards worked as an independent consultant in the field of building houses, bridges, and harbors. Appointed professor of building technology at Chalmers University of Technology in 1938. Contributed to the design of various structures, including the Katarina elevator, Gothenburg Concert Hall, the State Historical Museum, Halmstad City Hall, the Thule Hotel, and Södersjukhuset in Stockholm. Also involved in the construction of the Stockholm phosphorus factory in Stockvik and the Swedish shale oil plant in Kvarntorp, as well as the Svinesund Bridge, several bridge projects abroad, and the ocean quay in Karlshamn, among others. Participated in a study trip to Germany and Belgium at the request of the Civil Aeronautics Administration in 1936. Published works include the editorship of the magazine Betong from 1926 to 1937, "On the Elastic Stability of Piles etc" (doctoral dissertation) in 1929, a study on the suitability of concrete pipes for road culverts in 1934, "Load Distribution between Beams" in 1936, "On Damping of Vibrations" in 1941, "Reinforced Brick Structures" in 1943, and "Calculation of Suspension Bridges" in 1943. Additionally, authored numerous papers and dissertations on building statics and building technology.
